title: Measuring the Security of Mobile LLM Agents under Adversarial Prompts from Untrusted Third-Party Channels
summary: Large Language Models (LLMs) have transformed software development, enabling AI-powered applications known as LLM-based agents that promise to automate tasks across diverse apps and workflows. Yet, the security implications of deploying such agents in adversarial mobile environments remain poorly understood.
